頖字的基本解释

頖
pàn
〔頖宫〕又作“泮宫”，中国西周时诸侯所设的大学，如“大学在郊，天子曰辟廱，诸侯曰頖頖。”
涣散。

頖字的汉语字典释义

[①]［pàn］
［《廣韻》普半切，去换，滂。］
(1)颁布；分判。《礼记·王制》：“大學在郊，天子曰辟廱，諸侯曰頖宫。”孔颖达疏：“云'頖之言班也，所以班政教也'者，頖是分判之義，故爲班。於此學中施化，使人觀之，故云'所以班政教也。'”一说为半。孙希旦集解：“頖，《詩·魯頌》作'泮'，鄭云：'泮之言半也。半水者，蓋東西門以南通水，北無也。'辟廱、頖宫，天子諸侯大學之異名也。鄭此註云：'辟，明也。廱，和也。所以明和天下。頖之言頒也，所以頒政教也。'蓋鄭注《禮記》時未見《毛詩》傳，當以毛傳及鄭箋《詩》之説爲確。朱子《詩集傳》亦用毛傳、鄭箋之説。”参见“頖宫”。
(2)分别，离别。
(3)頖宫的省称。

頖字的康熙字典解释

【戌集下】【頁字部】　頖； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页1402第03
【廣韻】【集韻】【正韻】?普半切。同泮。【禮·王制】諸侯曰頖宮。【註】頖之言班也，所以班政敎也。又頖之言半也，以南通水北無水也。

頖字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
頖字的起名意思

暂无。

disperse
Basic explanation of words
disperse
pàn
〔頖宫〕also known as "Pan Palace", a university set up by princes in the Western Zhou Dynasty in China, such as "The university is in the suburbs, the emperor says Piqi, and the princes say 頖頖."
Loose.
disperse
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［pàn］
["Guangyun" is cut in half, go for it, punky. ]
(1) Issuing; sub-contracting. "Book of Rites · King System": "The university is in the suburbs, the emperor is called Piqi, and the princes are called the palace." Kong Yingdashu: "The word of the class is also the class, so the class is also the political and religious class, and the class is the meaning of division, so It is a class. In this study, it is applied to make people appreciate it, so it is said that'so class politics and education are also.'" One said half. Sun Xidan's collection: "Bie, "Poems of Lu Song" as'Pan', Zheng Yun:'Pan's words are half a word. Half water, the east and west gates are covered with water to the south, and there is nothing in the north.' Piqi, Bie Gong, Synonyms of the University of Emperors and Princes. Zheng Ji said: “Pei, Ming Ye. 廱, He Ye. Therefore, Ming and the world. The words of the Emperor are awarded, so the political and religious is also awarded.” When Zheng Zheng’s annotation "Book of Rites" was not seen, "Mao" For the biography of Poems, the statements of Mao Zhuan and Zheng Jian’s Poetry should be the correct ones. Zhu Zi’s “Book of Poetry Biography” also uses Mao Zhuan and Zheng Jian’s statement.
(2) Separately, parting.
(3) The provincial name of the palace.
